general:
General Help

**`Music commands`**:
- Commands that can manage the queue and playback such as
- **/add**, **/pause**, **/resume**, **/rewind** and more.

**`Website support`**:
- **YouTube** (video or playlist*) URLs.
- **Newgrounds** (audio **only**) URLs.
- **SoundCloud** (audio **only**) URLs
- **Bandcamp** (audio **only**) URLs
Non-URL queries will be treated as a 'standard' search query and will be passed to **YouTube search**. Refer to /add's help entry for URL formats.
_*Playlist support may depend on command._

**`Playlist support`**:
A maximum of **5** playlists is allowed per guild by default and each can contain **100** maximum tracks by default.

**`Permissions`**:
Optionally, for owners/users with Administrator permissions, a specified music/playlist role can be set as the default to allow execution of music/playlist commands respectively. This can be applied with the `/role-set` command. By default, no roles are set, users are free to use both music and playlist commands.

**`Bot behaviour`**:
The bot disconnects from a voice channel if no users are left in it as soon as the last user leaves to prevent unused guild data from piling up and welcomes any user that joins its current channel.

**`Moderation commands`**:
Commands that can be used to manage/moderate a Discord guild, some of them include basic moderation commands such as `/purge`, `/ban`, `/kick`, `/vckick`, `/vcmove` and commands for managing channels, such as `/make-text-channel`, `/make-voice-channel` etc.

> How do I use command X?
Use /help **{command}** to see its help entry.

> What to do in case of corrupted role/playlist structure? ('_Failed to read..._' error)
Use the `/role-reset` or `/playlist-delete-all rewrite:True` command.

> Why no **/volume**?
To prevent disputes over volume, each user manages their own volume output from the bot using Discord's '_user volume_' slider.
join:
Help for command: **join**
`Quick usage`
/join
`Description`
Invites the bot to join your voice channel.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user in voice channel, bot in none and must also have channel permission to `connect` and `speak`.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
leave:
Help for command: **leave**
`Quick usage`
/leave
`Description`
Makes the bot leave your voice channel.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no active extractions, queue modifications or locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
add:
Help for command: **add**
`Quick usage`
/add **<queries>**
`Description`
Adds **specified** track(s) (or playlist) to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<queries>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of **YouTube** (video or playlist), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud**, **Bandcamp** URLs or YouTube **search queries**.
`URL formats`
- **YouTube** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://youtube.com/watch?v=[ID]`** or **`https://youtube.com/playlist?list=[ID]`**
- **Newgrounds** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://newgrounds.com/audio/listen/[ID]`**
- **SoundCloud** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://soundcloud.com/[author]/[name]`**
- **Bandcamp** URLs must follow the following format: **`https://[user].bandcamp.com/track/[name]`**
`Examples`
- /add **queries:C418 Aria Math; C418 Sweden; https://soundcloud.com/tailspun/1f1n1ty-starstruck-by-day-by-night; Angelic Party\\; xi**
`Notes`
- Only up to **25** (default) queries can be sent per command.
- To search for queries that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
- Affects copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no active extractions or queue modifications.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playnow:
Help for command: **playnow**
`Quick usage`
/playnow **<query>** **<keep_current_track>**
`Description`
Plays the requested track **without** adding it to the queue. Stops any currently playing track.
`Parameters`
- **<query>** can be a **YouTube** (video **only**), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp** URL or YouTube **search query**. See /add help entry for URL formats.
- **<keep_current_track>** Whether or not to position back the current track (if any) in the queue at the first index. (default True)
`Examples`
- /playnow **query:bad apple!!**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no active extractions and no active queue modifications (if **<keep_current_track>** is True).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
skip:
Help for command: **skip**
`Quick usage`
/skip **<amount>**
`Description`
Skips the **current** (or **multiple**) track(s) and plays the next one.
`Parameters`
- **<amount>** is the amount of tracks to skip, must be > **1** and <= **25**. Starts from the current track.
`Examples`
- /skip **amount:2**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **1** track, /random must be disabled for any amount > **1**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
nextinfo:
Help for command: **nextinfo**
`Quick usage`
/nextinfo
`Description`
Shows information about the **next** track in the **queue**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
previousinfo:
Help for command: **previousinfo**
`Quick usage`
/previousinfo
`Description`
Shows information about the **previous** track in the **track history**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, and a track history with >= **2** tracks.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
pause:
Help for command: **pause**
`Quick usage`
/pause
`Description`
*Pauses** the **current** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and current track (if any) playback **must not be paused** already.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
resume:
Help for command: **resume**
`Quick usage`
/resume
`Description`
**Resumes** the **current** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and current track (if any) playback **must be paused**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
stop:
Help for command: **stop**
`Quick usage`
/stop
`Description`
**Stops** the current track and **resets** the bot's state to its default (join state).
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a playing/paused track and no active extractions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
restart:
Help for command: **restart**
`Quick usage`
/restart
`Description`
Restarts the current track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and active track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
select:
Help for command: **select**
`Quick usage`
/select **<track_name>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Selects **first occurrence** of track matching **<track_name>** name (or index) from the queue and plays it. Selected track is **removed** from the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** is the name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) of the track to select.
- **<by_index>** Selects track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /select **track_name:otherside**
- /select **track_name:2** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a queue with atleast **1** track, indices must be > 0 and < maximum index of the queue otherwise they'll be clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0) and no active queue modifications.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
replace:
Help for command: **replace**
`Quick usage`
/replace **<track_name>** **<new_track_query>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces first occurrence of track matching **<track_name>** name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) by fetching **another one** from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp**.
`Parameters`
- **<track_name>** is the track to replace's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new_track_query>** must be a **YouTube** (video only), **SoundCloud**, **Newgrounds**, **Bandcamp** URL or a YouTube **search query**. See /add help entry for URL formats.
- **<by_index>** Replaces track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /replace **track_name:Minecraft** **new_track_query:Sweden C418**
- /replace **track_name:5** **new_track_query:Sweden C418** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- Affects copied queue if **/queueloop** is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, track must be in queue and no active extractions or queue modifications.
- Indices must be > 0 and < maximum index of the queue otherwise they'll be clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
loop:
Help for command: **loop**
`Quick usage`
/loop
`Description`
Submits a request to loop the **current** track. Functions as a **toggle** and has **priority** over **/random** or **/queueloop**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a playing track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
random:
Help for command: **random**
`Quick usage`
/random
`Description`
Submits a request to **randomize** track selection. Functions as a **toggle**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
queueloop:
Help for command: **queueloop**
`Quick usage`
/queueloop **<include_current_track>**
`Description`
Submits a request to **loop the queue**. Queue is **restored** after the last track **finishes playing**. Functions as a **toggle**.
`Parameters`
- **<include_current_track>** whether or not to include the currently playing track (if any) in the copied queue. (default True)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, no active queue modifications and a queue with atleast **1** track in it.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
clear:
Help for command: **clear**
`Quick usage`
/clear **<clear_history>** **<clear_loop_queue>**
`Description`
Clears the queue, **removing** every track.
`Parameters`
- **<clear_history>** Clears track history if set to True (default False).
- **<clear_loop_queue>** Clears the copied queue produced by /queueloop if True. (default False)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a queue/track history with atleast **1** track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
remove:
Help for command: **remove**
`Quick usage`
/remove **<track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
**Removes** first occurrence of track **matching** each name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) in the **<track_names>** list from the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<by_index>** Removes tracks by their index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove **track_names:The End C418; click C418**
- /remove **track_names:6; 2** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- To remove tracks that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
- If a track is not found, it will be **ignored**.
- Indices must be > 0 and < maximum index of the queue otherwise they'll be clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, a queue with atleast **1** track in it and no active extractions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
reposition:
Help for command: **reposition**
`Quick usage`
/reposition **<track_name>** **<new_index>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Repositions first occurrence of track **matching <track_name>** name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) to new index **<new_index>** in the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<new_index>** is the new index for the track.
- **<by_index>** Repositions track by its index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /reposition **track_name:Strad C418** **new_index:3**
- /reposition **track_name:4** **new_index:3** **by_index:True**.
`Notes`
- To reposition tracks that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolon with '\\'.
- Does not affect the copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
- Indices must be > 0 and < maximum index of the queue otherwise they'll be clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **2** tracks, **<new_index>** must not be the same as the current one and should be > 0 and <= maximum index of the queue and no active queue modifications.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
shuffle:
Help for command: **shuffle**
`Quick usage`
/shuffle
`Description`
Shuffles the queue in **random** order.
`Notes`
- Does not affect copied queue if /queueloop is enabled.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **2** tracks and no active queue modifications.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
seek:
Help for command: **seek**
`Quick usage`
/seek **<time>**
`Description`
Sets the track position to a user specified time formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:30**).
`Examples`
- /seek **time:00:05:00**
- /seek **time:5:00**
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **<time>** must be > 0 and < track duration and an active or paused track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
rewind:
Help for command: **rewind**
`Quick usage`
/rewind **<time>**
`Description`
Rewinds the track by a specified time formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:30**).
`Examples`
- /rewind **time:00:00:10**
- /rewind **time:10**
`Requirements`Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, **<time>** must be > 0 and < track duration and an active or paused track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
forward:
Help for command: **forward**
`Quick usage`
/forward **<time>**
`Description`
Forwards the track by a specified time formatted to **HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:30**).
`Examples`
- /forward **time:00:00:30**
- /forward **time:30**
`Requirements`
Music role if set up, user and bot in voice channel, **<time>** must be > 0 and < track duration and an active or paused track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
queue:
Help for command: **queue**
`Quick usage`
/queue **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a queue page.
`Parameters`
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > **0**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, queue with atleast **1** track and no active queue modifications.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
history:
Help for command: **history**
`Quick usage`
/history **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a track history **page**.
`Parameters`
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > 0.
`Notes`
- Only up to **200** (default) tracks can be logged. Once this limit is reached, the bot will start **replacing** entries from the beginning with new ones.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, track history with atleast **1** track.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
progress:
Help for command: **progress**
`Quick usage`
/progress
`Description`
Shows info about the **current** extraction process.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and a track being extracted.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
epoch:
Help for command: **epoch**
`Quick usage`
/epoch
`Description`
Shows the **elapsed time** that has passed since the **first** track.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and have played atleast one track since join time.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
yoink:
Help for command: **yoink**
`Quick usage`
/yoink
`Description`
Sends a DM containing information about the current track to the user **who invoked the command**.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel, an active track playback and user must accept DMs from the bot.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
nowplaying:
Help for command: **nowplaying**
`Quick usage`
/nowplaying
`Description`
Shows information such as **title**, **author**, **duration**, **elapsed time** since the start and more about the current track in an embed.
`Requirements`
Music role if set, user and bot in voice channel and an active track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-view:
Help for command: **playlist-view**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-view **<playlist_name>** **<page>**
`Description`
Shows the first **25** tracks of a playlist page.
`Parameters`
- **<page>** is the page to display. Must be > 0.
`Examples`
- /playlist-view **playlist_name:GeometryDash** **page:1**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** must exist and not be empty and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-save:
Help for command: **playlist-save**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-save **<playlist_name>**
`Description`
Creates a new playlist with the **current** queue.
`Parameters`
- **<add_current_track>** whether or not to add the current track at the start of the new playlist. (default True)
`Examples`
- /playlist-save **playlist_name:StardewValley**.
`Notes`
- This command **cannot** be run on playlists that already exist and have **1** or more tracks in them.
`Requirements`
Music and playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active queue modifications, **playlist** must not exist already or must be empty, queue must have <= **100** (default) elements, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and playlist count must be < **5** (default) if creating one, and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-save-current:
Help for command: **playlist-save-current**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-save-current **<playlist_name>** **<index>**
`Description`
**Appends** the current track to the given playlist or **places** it at the given index.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<index>** is the new track's index. Must be > 0 and <= the maximum index of the playlist.
`Examples`
- /playlist-save-current **playlist_name:Random**
- /playlist-save-current **playlist_name:Random** **index:3**
`Notes`
- Indices that go **out of bounds** are **clamped** to the closest extreme of the queue (ex. -2 --> 0).
`Requirements`
User and bot in voice channel, Music and Playlist role (if set), **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters, **playlist** count must be < **5** (default) if creating one and an active track playback.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-select:
Help for command: **playlist-select**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-select **<playlist_name>** **<clear_current_queue>** **<range_start>** **<range_end>**
`Description`
Adds all playlist tracks from range **<range_start>** to range **<range_end>** to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select.
- **<clear_current_queue>** indicates whether or not the current queue should be cleared of all tracks in it. (default True)
- **<range_start>** indicates the start index of track selection, must be < **<range_end>** (default is 1).
- **<range_end>** indicates at what index track selection should stop, must be > **<range_start>** and < index of the final track in the playlist (default is the index of the last track in the playlist).
`Examples`
- /playlist-select **playlist_name:StardewValley** **range_start:5**
- /playlist-select **playlist_name:Random** **clear_current_queue:False**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions or queue modifications, **playlist** must exist and have >= **1** track in it and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-create:
Help for command: **playlist-create**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-create **<playlist_name>**
`Description`
Creates a **blank** playlist with the specified name.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the new playlist's name.
`Examples`
- /playlist-create **playlist_name:Minecraft**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** must not exist already, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters, **playlist** count must be < **5** (default) and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-delete:
Help for command: **playlist-delete**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-delete **<playlist_name>** **<erase_contents_only>**
`Description`
Deletes the specified playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to delete's name.
- **<erase_contents_only>** Deletes only the contents of the playlist. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-delete **playlist_name:Useless Playlist**
- /playlist-delete **playlist_name:Random** **erase_contents_only:True**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** must exist and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-remove:
Help for command: **playlist-remove**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-remove **<playlist_name>** **<track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Removes first occurrence of track **matching** each name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) in **<track_names>** list from a playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to remove tracks from's name.
- **<track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True) to bulk remove.
- **<by_index>** Removes tracks by their index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-remove **playlist_name:Minecraft** **track_names:bad apple**
- /playlist-remove **playlist_name:Minecraft** **track_names: 1; 3** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- To remove tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
- If a track is not found, it will be **ignored**.
- Indices that **go out of bounds** are clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** and **tracks** must exist, and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-delete-all:
Help for command: **playlist-delete-all**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-delete-all **<rewrite>**
`Description`
Deletes **all** saved playlists for the current guild.
`Parameters`
- **<rewrite>** Whether or not to completely rewrite the structure. Useful if it cannot be read anymore. (default False)
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in voice channel and atleast **1** saved **playlist** (if **<rewrite>** is False).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-rename:
Help for command: **playlist-rename**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-rename **<playlist_name>** **<new_playlist_name>**
`Description`
**Renames** a playlist to the specified **new name**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the original name of the playlist to rename.
- **<new_playlist_name>** is the new playlist's name.
`Examples`
- /playlist-rename **playlist_name:Minecraft** **new_playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, playlist must exist, **<new_playlist_name>** must be <= **50** (default) characters and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-replace:
Help for command: **playlist-replace**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-replace **<playlist_name>** **<old>** **<new>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces first track matching **<old>** name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) with a new one fetched from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<old>** is the track to replace's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new>** can be a **YouTube** (video only), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud**, **Bandcamp** URL or a YouTube **search query**. See /add help entry for URL formats.
- **<by_index>** Replaces tracks by their index. If True, **<old>** becomes a list of indices instead of names. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-replace **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old:Sweden** **new:C418 Ki**
- /playlist-replace **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old: 3** **new: C418 Ki** **by_index:True**
`Notes`
- Indices that go **out of bounds** are clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions, **playlist** and **<old>** track must exist and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-reposition:
Help for command: **playlist-reposition**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-reposition **<playlist_name>** **<track_name>** **<index>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Repositions first track matching **<track_name>** name (or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) from its **original index** to **new index <index>** in the playlist.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<track_name>** is the track to reposition's name (or index, if **<by_index>** is True)
- **<index>** is the **new index** of the track.
- **<by_index>** Replaces tracks by their index. (default False)
`Examples`
- /playlist-reposition **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_name:Dreiton** **index:1**
- /playlist-reposition **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **track_name:4** **index:1** **by_index:True**
`Notes`- Indices that go **out of bounds** are be clamped to the **closest extreme** of the playlist. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** and track must exist, index **<index>** must not be the **same as the current one** and must be > 0 and <= maximum index of the playlist, and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-add:
Help for command: **playlist-add**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-add **<playlist_name>** **<queries>**
`Description`
Adds **specified queries** fetched from **YouTube**, **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp** to a playlist, **creating one** if necessary.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to create or modify's name.
- **<queries>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of **YouTube** (video **only**), **Newgrounds**, **SoundCloud** or **Bandcamp** URLs or YouTube **search queries**. See /add help entry for URL formats.
`Notes`
- To search for queries that have a semicolon in them, **prefix** the semicolon first with '\\'.
`Examples`
- /playlist-add **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Alpha** **queries:C418 Sweden; C418 Living Mice; C418 Minecraft**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions, **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** characters if creating one and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-fetch-track:
Help for command: **playlist-fetch-track**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-fetch-track **<playlist_name>** **<tracks>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Adds **specified playlist tracks** (either by name, or index, in case **<by_index>** is True) to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select tracks from's name.
- **<tracks>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True) from the playlist.
- **<by_index>** Fetches tracks by their index. (default False)
`Notes`
- Only up to **25** (default) queries can be sent per command
- To search for tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
If a track is not found, it will be **ignored**.
- Indices that go **out of bounds** are clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Examples`
- /playlist-fetch-track **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **tracks:Dreiton; Taswell**
- /playlist-fetch-track **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **tracks: 4; 5** **by_index:True**
`Requirements`Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions or queue modifications, **playlist** and tracks must exist and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-fetch-random-track:
Help for command: **playlist-fetch-random-track**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-fetch-random-track **<playlist_name>** **<amount>**
`Description`
Choses a random, specified **<amount>** of tracks and adds them to the queue.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to select tracks from's name.
- **<amount>** is the amount of random tracks to select. Must be <= **25**.
`Notes`
- The same track may be chosen **multiple times**, as a result, **duplicates might exist** in the queue.
`Examples`
- /playlist-fetch-random-track **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Alpha** **amount:5**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions or queue modifications, **playlist** must exist and not be empty and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-add-yt-playlist:
Help for command: **playlist-add-yt-playlist**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-add-yt-playlist **<playlist_name>** **<query>**
`Description`
**Creates** or **adds** tracks to a playlist from a specified YouTube playlist URL.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify or create's name.
- **<query>** must be a YouTube **playlist URL**. See /add help entry for URL formats.
`Examples`
- /playlist-add-yt-playlist **playlist_name:Cookie Clicker** **query:https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=OLAK5uy_keWBIVtHjna-VvhL5_XCB0BaNx-2Y0PK8**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, no active extractions, YouTube playlist must not exceed the **playlist track limit** (**100** default), **<playlist_name>** must be <= **50** characters, **playlist** count must be < **5** (default) if creating one and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **30** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-edit-track:
Help for command: **playlist-edit-track**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-edit-track **<playlist_name>** **<old_track_names>** **<new_track_names>** **<by_index>**
`Description`
Replaces the **original** title of a track (or a **sequence of tracks**) with a **new** one (or a **sequence of new names**).
`Parameters`
- **<playlist_name>** is the playlist to modify's name.
- **<old_track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of track names (or indices, if **<by_index>** is True).
- **<new_track_names>** must be a semicolon (;) separated list of new names to assign to the old tracks.
- **<by_index>** Renames tracks by their index. (default False)
`Notes`
- To edit tracks that have semicolons in them, **prefix** the semicolons first with '\\'.
- If the length of a new name is **too long** (> **50** (default) characters) or a track is **not found**, it will be **ignored**.
- Indices that go **out of bounds** are clamped to the **closest extreme** of the queue. (ex. -2 --> 0)
`Examples`
- /playlist-edit-track **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old_track_names: C418 Ki; C418 Ward** **new_track_names: Ki; Ward**
- /playlist-edit-track **playlist_name:Minecraft Volume Beta** **old_track_names: 2; 4** **new_track_names: Ki; Ward**
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), user and bot in a voice channel, **playlist** and tracks to rename must exist and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
playlist-get-saved:
Help for command: **playlist-get-saved**
`Quick usage`
/playlist-get-saved
`Description`
Shows the saved playlists for the **current** guild.
`Requirements`
Music and Playlist role (if set), guild must have atleast **one** playlist and no locked playlists.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-set:
Help for command: **role-set**
`Quick usage`
/role-set **<role>** **<playlist>** **<overwrite>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Sets** the default music/playlist role that users **must have** in order to execute music/playlist commands.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role name and must exist in the guild.
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the set role should be the playlist role.
- **<overwrite>** Whether or not the current role (if it exists) should be **overwritten** with the **new one**. (default False)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /role-set **role:DJ** **playlist:False**
- /role-set **role:DJ+** **playlist:True**
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-get:
Help for command: **role-get**
`Quick usage`
/role-get **<playlist>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Shows** the default music/playlist role set for the **current guild**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the command should read the playlist role.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-wipe:
Help for command: **role-wipe**
`Quick usage`
/role-wipe **<role>** **<playlist>** **<show>**
`Description`
**Removes** the default music/playlist role set for the **current guild**.
`Parameters`
- **<playlist>** indicates whether or not the command should remove the playlist role.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Administrator or Owner permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
role-reset:
Help for command: **role-reset**
`Quick usage`
/role-reset **<show>**
`Description`
Rewrites the saved role structure in case of **corruption** or need to bulk delete all roles.
`Parameters`
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Requirements`
Owner or Administrator permissions.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **60** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
purge:
Help for command: **purge**
`Quick usage`
/purge **<channel>** **<amount>** **<user>** **<word>** **<show>**
`Description`
Bulk removes specified amount of messages from a specified channel.
`Parameters`
- **<channel>** is the channel to purge. (defaults to current channel).
- **<amount>** is the maximum amount of messages to delete, must be <= 1000 (default 100).
- **<user>** If filled, only deletes messages sent by user **<user>**. (default None)
- **<word>** If filled, only deletes messages that have the word **<word>** in them. (default None)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /purge **amount:50** **channel:#general-english** **show:True**
- /purge **user:@john**
`Requirements`
Manage messages permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **45** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
kick:
Help for command: **kick**
`Quick usage`
/kick **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Kicks specified member from the guild.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to kick. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the kick reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /kick **member: @peter** **reason:spam** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Kick members permission (both user and bot), user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
ban:
Help for command: **ban**
`Quick usage`
/ban **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Bans specified member from the guild.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to ban. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the ban reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel (default False).
`Examples`
- /ban **member: @peter** **reason:violated server rules multiple times.** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Ban members permission (both user and bot), user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
unban:
Help for command: **unban**
`Quick usage`
/unban **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Unbans specified member, allowing them to join the guild again.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** can be the username, global name or ID of the member to unban.
- **<reason>** is the unban reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /unban **member:peter** **reason:apologized** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Ban member permission (both user and bot) and target member must be in unban entries.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
timeout:
Help for command: **timeout**
`Quick usage`
/timeout **<duration>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Times out specified member. Forbidding them from sending messages.
`Parameters`
- **<duration>** is the timeout duration. Must be a time value formatted to **DD:HH:MM:SS** (or shorter, such as **1:00:00**), day cannot be higher than **28**.
- **<member>** is the member to timeout. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the timeout reason. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /timeout **duration: 00:05:00:00** **member:@lana** **reason: annoying people in general** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Manage members permission (both user and bot), target member must not be timed out already, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
deltimeout:
Help for command: **deltimeout**
`Quick usage`
/deltimeout **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Removes timeout from specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to remove timeout from. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for removing the timeout. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /deltimeout **member:@lana** **reason:apologized** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Manage members permission (both user and bot) and target member must be timed out.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
add-role:
Help for command: **add-role**
`Quick usage`
/add-role **<role>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Adds specified role to specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role to add. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<member>** is the member to add the role to, can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for adding the role. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /add-role **role:@DJ** **member:@peter**
`Requirements`
Manage roles permission (both user and bot), target member must not already have specified role and user and bot's top role must be higher than specified role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
remove-role:
Help for command: **remove-role**
`Quick usage`
/remove-role **<role>** **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Removes specified role from specified member.
`Parameters`
- **<role>** is the role to remove. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<member>** is the member to remove the role from. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for removing role from member. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /remove-role **role:@DJ** **member:@peter**
`Requirements`
Manage roles permission (both user and bot), target member must have specified role, user and bot's top role must be higher than specified role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
delchannel:
Help for command: **delchannel**
`Quick usage`
/delchannel **<channel>** **<type>** **<show>**
`Description`
Deletes the specified channel matching a specified type.
`Parameters`
- **<channel>** is the channel to delete. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<type>** is the type of the target channel. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /delchannel **channel:#general-english** **type:text** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **10** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
make-text-channel:
Help for command: **make-text-channel**
`Quick usage`
/make-text-channel **<name>** **<topic>** **<category>** **<announcement>** **<slowmode_delay>** **<nsfw>** **<position>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a text channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the name of the new channel.
- **<topic>** is the channel topic. Appears at the top of the text channel chat box. (defaults to none)
- **<category>** is the category to apply the channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<announcement>** Whether or not the channel is an announcement channel. **Requires a community-enabled guild.** (default False)
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay to apply to the channel, must be in seconds. Maximum is 21600. (defaults to 0)
- **<nsfw>** can be true or false, marks the channel as NSFW if true. (default False)
- **<position>** is the position of the new channels relative to all channels, the lower the number, the higher the channel is on the channel list, the higher, the lower the channel is on the channel list. Must be >= 0. (defaults to 0)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-text-channel **name:coolchannel** **category:#coolchannels** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
make-voice-channel:
Help for command: **make-voice-channel**
`Quick usage`
/make-voice-channel **<name>** **<category>** **<position>** **<bitrate>** **<user_limit>** **<video_quality_mode>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a voice channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the name of the new channel.
- **<category>** is the category to apply the new channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<position>** is the position of the new channel relative to the all channels. The lower, the higher the channel will be, the higher, the lower the channel will be. Must be >= 0. (defaults to 0)
- **<bitrate>** is the new channel's bitrate, must be >= 8000 and <= 96000. (defaults to 64000)
- **<user_limit>** is the maximum amount of users that can join the channel. Must be <= 99. (defaults to 0 (infinite))
- **<video_quality_mode>** is the video quality mode, if unsure, leave the default (auto).
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-voice-channel **name:coolchannel** **category:#coolchannels** **user_limit:20**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
make-category:
Help for command: **make-category**
`Quick usage`
/make-category **<name>** **<position>** **<show>**
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new category's name.
- **<position>** is the new category's position relative to all categories. The lower the number, the higher the category will be, the higher, the lower the category will be. (defaults to 0)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-category **name:coolerchannels** **position:0** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
make-forum:
Help for command: **make-forum**
`Quick usage`
/make-forum **<name>** **<post_guidelines>** **<position>** **<category>** **<slowmode_delay>** **<nsfw>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a forum channel with the given parameters.
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new forum's name.
- **<post_guidelines>** is the new forum's posting guidelines that appear when a member makes a new post. (defaults to none)
- **<position>** is the position of the new forum relative to all channels. The lower the number, the higher the channel is, the higher, the lower the channel will be. (defaults to 0).
- **<category>** is the category to apply the forum to. Leave empty for none.
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay to apply for this forum in seconds. Maximum is 21600. (defaults to 0)
- **<nsfw>** can be true or false, indicates whether or not the forum is NSFW. (default False)
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-forum **name:anime** **category:#Media** **slowmode_delay:60**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot) and a **community-enabled guild**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
make-stage:
Help for command: **make-stage**
`Quick usage`
/make-stage **<name>** **<category>** **<position>** **<bitrate>** **<video_quality_mode>** **<show>**
`Description`
Creates a stage channel with the given parameters
`Parameters`
- **<name>** is the new stage channel's name.
- **<category>** is the category to apply the new stage channel to. Leave empty for none.
- **<position>** is the position of the new stage channel relative to all channels. The lower the number, the higher the channel is, the higher, the lower the channel is. Must be >= 0 (defaults to 0).
- **<bitrate>** is the new stage channel's bitrate. Must be >= 8000 and <= 64000 (defaults to 64000)
- **<video_quality_mode>** is the new channel's video quality mode, if unsure, leave the default (auto).
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /make-stage **name:coolstage** **category:#coolchannels**
`Requirements`
Manage channels (both user and bot) and a **community-enabled guild**.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
slowmode:
Help for command: **slowmode**
`Quick usage`
/slowmode **<slowmode_delay>** **<channel>** **<show>**
`Description`
Changes the slowmode delay of the current/specified channel.
`Parameters`
- **<slowmode_delay>** is the slowmode delay in seconds. Maximum is 21600. (defaults to 0)
- **<channel>** is the channel to apply the new slowmode delay value to. Leave empty for current one.
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
- /slowmode **slowmode_delay:5**
- /slowmode **slowmode_delay:300** **channel:#media**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (both user and bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **20** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
announce:
Help for command: **announce**
`Quick usage`
/announce **<message>** **<channel>** **<no_markdown>** **<no_mentions>**
`Description`
Announce a message in a specified text channel.
`Parameters`
- **<message>** is the message to announce, must be < **2000** characters. Supports mentions and markdown.
- **<channel>** is the channel to announce the message in. Leave empty for current channel.
- **<no_markdown>** Whether or not to ignore markdown text formatting (Ex. **hi** --> hi). (default False)
- **<no_mentions>** Whether or not to ignore formatting of mentions. (default False)
`Examples`
- /announce **message: Hi @everyone!**
- /announce **message:@peter has been demoted for breaking staff rules.** **channel:#moderator-only**
`Requirements`
Manage channels permission (user), Send messages (bot).
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
vckick:
Help for command: **vckick**
`Quick usage`
/vckick **<member>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Kicks specified member from their current voice channel.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to kick. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for kicking the user from its voice channel. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vckick **member:@john** **reason:being disruptive** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Move members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in a voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
vcmove:
Help for command: **vcmove**
`Quick usage`
/vcmove **<member>** **<target_voice_channel>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Moves specified member from its current voice channel to target voice channel.
- **<member>** is the member to move. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<target_voice_channel>** is the target voice channel to move member to. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<reason>** is the reason for moving member to channel target voice channel. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vcmove **member:@alex** **target_voice_channel:#afk** **reason:afk** **show:False**
`Requirements`
Move members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in a voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role, bot must have permission to connect to both the source (target member's channel) and target channel.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
vcmute:
Help for command: **vcmute**
`Quick usage`
/vcmute **<member>** **<mute>** **<reason>** **<show>**
`Description`
Mutes specified member in voice channel.
`Parameters`
- **<member>** is the member to mute. Can be chosen using Discord's selection tool.
- **<mute>** can be true or false, a value of false will unmute. (default True)
- **<reason>** is the reason for mute/unmute. (defaults to 'None')
- **<show>** Whether or not to broadcast the action in the current channel. (default False)
`Examples`
/vcmute **member:@lana** **mute:True** **reason:being annoying** **show:True**
`Requirements`
Mute members permission (both user and bot), target member must be in voice channel, user and bot's top role must be higher than target member's role.
`Cooldown`
Has a cooldown of **15** (default) seconds **per-guild**.
